verses.roman:
kadācid yamunā-tīre
vatsāṁś cārayatoḥ svakaiḥ
vayasyaiḥ kṛṣṇa-balayor
jighāṁsur daitya āgamat

synonyms: kadācit—sometimes; yamunā-tīre—on the bank of the Yamunā; vatsān—the calves; cārayatoḥ—when They were tending; svakaiḥ—Their own; vayasyaiḥ—with other playmates; kṛṣṇa-balayoḥ—both Kṛṣṇa and Balarāma; jighāṁsuḥ—desiring to kill Them; daityaḥ—another demon; āgamat—reached there.
translation: One day while Rāma and Kṛṣṇa, along with Their playmates, were tending the calves on the bank of the River Yamunā, another demon arrived there, desiring to kill Them.
